workflow.display-name: Linked clone, Linux with multiple NICs
workflow.description: Creates a linked clone of a Linux virtual machine, performs the guest operating system customization, and configures up to four virtual network cards.

param.name: folder
param.description: Virtual machine folder

param.name: name
param.description: New virtual machine name

param.name: vm
param.description: Virtual machine of which to create a linked clone

param.name: powerOn
param.description: Specifies whether or not the new virtual machine should be powered on after creation

param.name: template
param.description: Specifies whether or not to mark the new virtual machine as a template

param.name: datastore
param.description: Datastore in which to store the virtual machine. If not specified, the current datastore is used

param.name: host
param.description: (Optional) Host on which to create the virtual machine

param.name: pool
param.description: (Optional) Resource pool in which to create the virtual machine

param.name: doSysprep
param.description: Run the Sysprep operations and wait for the task to complete. Not used if the virtual machine is marked as template

param.name: clientName
param.description: Name or prefix name of the Linux client

param.name: numberOfNic
param.description: Number of virtual network cards for the new virtual machine

param.name: nic1Network
param.description: (Optional) Network on which to attach the virtual network interface. No NIC is defined if network is not specified

param.name: nic1DnsServerList
param.description: (Optional) List of DNS servers for a virtual network adapter with a static IP address

param.name: nic1DnsDomain
param.description: (Optional) DNS domain suffix such as vmware.com

param.name: nic1Dhcp
param.description: (Optional if no NIC1) Use a DHCP server to configure the virtual network adapter

param.name: nic1Gateway
param.description: (Optional) List of gateways, in order of preference

param.name: nic1IpAddress
param.description: (Optional if no NIC1) Fixed valid IP address

param.name: nic1MacAddress
param.description: (Optional) The MAC address of a network adapter being customized. If it is not included, the customization process maps the settings from the virtual machine's network adapters, in PCI slot order

param.name: nic1SubnetMask
param.description: (Optional) Subnet mask for this virtual network adapter

param.name: nic2Network
param.description: (Optional) Network on which to attach the virtual network interface. No NIC is defined if network is not specified

param.name: nic2DnsServerList
param.description: (Optional) List of DNS servers for a virtual network adapter with a static IP address

param.name: nic2DnsDomain
param.description: (Optional) DNS domain suffix such as vmware.com

param.name: nic2Dhcp
param.description: (Optional if no NIC2) Use a DHCP server to configure the virtual network adapter

param.name: nic2Gateway
param.description: (Optional) List of gateways, in order of preference

param.name: nic2IpAddress
param.description: (Optional if no NIC2) Fixed valid IP address

param.name: nic2MacAddress
param.description: (Optional) The MAC address of a network adapter being customized. If it is not included, the customization process maps the settings from the virtual machine's network adapters, in PCI slot order

param.name: nic2SubnetMask
param.description: (Optional) Subnet mask for this virtual network adapter

param.name: nic3Network
param.description: (Optional) Network on which to attach the virtual network interface. No NIC is defined if network is not specified

param.name: nic3DnsServerList
param.description: (Optional) List of DNS servers for a virtual network adapter with a static IP address

param.name: nic3DnsDomain
param.description: (Optional) DNS domain suffix such as vmware.com

param.name: nic3Dhcp
param.description: (Optional if no NIC3) Use a DHCP server to configure the virtual network adapter

param.name: nic3Gateway
param.description: (Optional) List of gateways, in order of preference

param.name: nic3IpAddress
param.description: (Optional if no NIC3) Fixed valid IP address

param.name: nic3MacAddress
param.description: (Optional) The MAC address of a network adapter being customized. If it is not included, the customization process maps the settings from the virtual machine's network adapters, in PCI slot order

param.name: nic3SubnetMask
param.description: (Optional) Subnet mask for this virtual network adapter

param.name: nic4Network
param.description: (Optional) Network on which to attach the virtual network interface. No NIC is defined if network is not specified

param.name: nic4DnsServerList
param.description: (Optional) List of DNS servers for a virtual network adapter with a static IP address

param.name: nic4DnsDomain
param.description: (Optional) DNS domain suffix such as vmware.com

param.name: nic4Dhcp
param.description: (Optional if no NIC4) Use a DHCP server to configure the virtual network adapter

param.name: nic4Gateway
param.description: (Optional) List of gateways, in order of preference

param.name: nic4IpAddress
param.description: (Optional if no NIC4) Fixed valid IP address

param.name: nic4MacAddress
param.description: (Optional) The MAC address of a network adapter being customized. If it is not included, the customization process maps the settings from the virtual machine's network adapters, in PCI slot order

param.name: nic4SubnetMask
param.description: (Optional) Subnet mask for this virtual network adapter

param.name: Snapshot
param.description: If null, a new snapshot shall be created

param.name: newVM
param.description: The newly created virtual machine

attrib.name: task
attrib.description: Task to await

attrib.name: progress
attrib.description: Log progress while waiting for the task to complete

attrib.name: pollRate
attrib.description: Polling rate for the task state, in seconds

attrib.name: spec
attrib.description: Specifies how to clone the virtual machine (VimVirtualMachineCloneSpec)

attrib.name: location
attrib.description: Specifies the location of resources the cloned virtual machine will be using (VirtualMachineRelocateSpec)

attrib.name: customization
attrib.description: Optional guest operating system customization specification (CustomizationSpec)

attrib.name: globalIPSettings
attrib.description: Global IP settings constitute the IP settings that are not specific to a particular virtual network adapter (VimCustomizationGlobalIPSettings)

attrib.name: identity
attrib.description: Network identity and settings, similar to Microsoft's Sysprep tool. This is a Sysprep, LinuxPrep, or SysprepText object (VimCustomizationIdentitySettings)

attrib.name: nicSettingMaps
attrib.description: (Optional) IP settings that are specific to a particular virtual network adapter (an array of VimCustomizationAdapterMapping)

attrib.name: options
attrib.description: Optional operations (VimCustomizationOptions: LinuxOptions or WinOptions)

attrib.name: adapterMapping
attrib.description: Data object type to associate a virtual network adapter with its IP settings

attrib.name: startVm
attrib.description: Specifies whether to start the cloned virtual machine. Depends on the values set for 'template', 'doSysprep' and 'powerOn' attributes

attrib.name: tempNewVm
attrib.description: The newly created virtual machine

attrib.name: pollingRate
attrib.description: Polling rate for the task state, in seconds

attrib.name: timeout
attrib.description: Timeout period to elapse before throwing a timeout exception, in minutes

attrib.name: config
attrib.description: (Optional) Specification of changes to the virtual hardware (VirtualMachineConfigSpec)

attrib.name: deviceChange
attrib.description: (Optional) Set of virtual devices being modified by the configuration operation (an array of VirtualDeviceConfigSpec)

attrib.name: addNumberToName
attrib.description: Append a number to the client name to ensure the name is unique

attrib.name: neverStart
attrib.description: Specifies whether or not to power on the new virtual machine

attrib.name: pollRateCustomization
attrib.description: Polling rate for the customization task state, in seconds

attrib.name: targetDatastore
attrib.description: Datastore in which to store the virtual machine

attrib.name: templateAttr
attrib.description: Specifies whether or not to mark the new virtual machine as a template

attrib.name: errorCode
attrib.description: Error code

attrib.name: snapshot
attrib.description: VcVirtualMachineSnapshot on which to base the clone

attrib.name: wasTemplate
attrib.description: Virtual machine is marked as template

attrib.name: nicNumberValues
attrib.description: An array of the NICs to use

attrib.name: nicPosition
attrib.description: Choose to get the 1st, 2nd, 3rd, 4th, or 5th network card. Gets the first NIC by default.

attrib.name: sourceVirtualEthernetCard
attrib.description: The VirtualEthernetCard the template defines

workflow-note.description: Wait for the sysprep operation to be terminated
Customize here: if NIC number change, cannot clone + change NIC number + customize with new NIC number at same time

workflow-item.name: item0
workflow-item.script: //Auto generated script, cannot be modified ! System.getModule("com.vmware.library.vc.vm.spec").checkVMwareInput(vm,folder,datastore,host,pool) ;

bind.name: datastore
bind.description: Target datastore

bind.name: folder
bind.description: Target folder

bind.name: host
bind.description: Target host

bind.name: pool
bind.description: Target pool

bind.name: vm
bind.description: VM to clone

workflow-item.name: item4
workflow-item.script: //Auto generated script, cannot be modified ! actionResult = System.getModule("com.vmware.library.vc.vm.spec").getCloneSpec(config,customization,location,powerOn,template) ;

bind.name: config
bind.description: [optional] VirtualMachineConfigSpec: An optional specification of changes to the virtual hardware.

bind.name: customization
bind.description: [optional] CustomizationSpec: An optional guest operating system customization specification.

bind.name: location
bind.description: VirtualMachineRelocateSpec: A type of RelocateSpec that specifies the location of resources the newly cloned virtual machine will use

bind.name: powerOn
bind.description: Specifies whether or not the new VirtualMachine should be powered on after creation

bind.name: template
bind.description: Specifies whether or not the new virtual machine should be marked as a template.

workflow-item.name: item6
workflow-item.script: //Auto generated script, cannot be modified ! actionResult = System.getModule("com.vmware.library.vc.vm.spec").getRelocateSpec(datastore,disk,host,pool,transform) ;

bind.name: pool
bind.description: [optional] The resource pool to which this virtual machine should be attached.

bind.name: disk
bind.description: [optional] Array of VirtualMachineRelocateSpecDiskLocator: An optional list that allows specifying the datastore location for each virtual disk.

bind.name: transform
bind.description: [optional] Transformation to perform on the disks.

bind.name: host
bind.description: [optional] The target host for the virtual machine.

bind.name: datastore
bind.description: [optional] The datastore where the virtual machine should be located. If not specified, the current datastore is used

workflow-item.name: item7
workflow-item.script: //Auto generated script, cannot be modified ! actionResult = System.getModule("com.vmware.library.vc.vm.spec").getCustomizationSpec(globalIPSettings,identity,nicSettingMap,options) ;

bind.name: options
bind.description: [Optional] VimCustomizationOptions: Optional operations (either LinuxOptions or WinOptions).

bind.name: nicSettingMap
bind.description: [Optional] Array of VimCustomizationAdapterMapping: IP settings that are specific to a particular virtual network adapter.

bind.name: identity
bind.description: VimCustomizationIdentitySettings: Network identity and settings, similar to Microsoft's Sysprep tool. This is a Sysprep, LinuxPrep, or SysprepText object.

bind.name: globalIPSettings
bind.description: VimCustomizationGlobalIPSettings: Global IP settings constitute the IP settings that are not specific to a particular virtual network adapter.

bind.name: dhcp
bind.description: Use a DHCP server to configure the virtual network adapter.

bind.name: dnsDomain
bind.description: [Optional] A DNS domain suffix such as dunes.ch.

bind.name: dnsServerList
bind.description: [Optional] A list of server IP addresses to use for DNS lookup in a Windows guest operating system.

bind.name: gateway
bind.description: [Optional] List of gateways, in order of preference.

bind.name: ipAddress
bind.description: A Fixed valid IP Address

bind.name: macAddress
bind.description: [Optional] The MAC address of a network adapter being customized. If it is not included, the customization process maps the settings from the virtual machine's network adapters, in PCI slot order.

bind.name: netBIOS
bind.description: [Optional] NetBIOS setting for Windows.

bind.name: primaryWINS
bind.description: [Optional] The IP address of the primary WINS server. This property is ignored for Linux guest operating systems.

bind.name: secondaryWINS
bind.description: [Optional] The IP address of the secondary WINS server. This property is ignored for Linux guest operating systems.

bind.name: subnetMask
bind.description: [Optional] Subnet mask for this virtual network adapter.

bind.name: adapterMapping
bind.description: Data object type to associate a virtual network adapter with its IP settings.

workflow-item.name: item10
workflow-item.script: nicSettingMaps.push(adapterMapping);

workflow-item.name: item1
item12
workflow-item.script: //Generated by the system, cannot be edited return (template == true) ;

workflow-item.name: item13
workflow-item.script: newVM = tempNewVm;

workflow-item.name: item15
workflow-item.script: //Generated by the system, cannot be edited return (doSysprep == true) ;

workflow-item.name: item18
workflow-item.script: //Generated by the system, cannot be edited return (powerOn == true) ;

workflow-item.name: item26
workflow-item.script: //Auto generated script, cannot be modified ! actionResult = System.getModule("com.vmware.library.vc.vm.spec").getConfigSpecSimple(deviceChange,files,flags,memoryMB,name,numCPUs) ;

bind.name: deviceChange
bind.description: [optional] Array of VirtualDeviceConfigSpec: Set of virtual devices being modified by the configuration operation.

bind.name: files
bind.description: [optional] VirtualMachineFileInfo: Information about virtual machine files

bind.name: flags
bind.description: [optional] VirtualMachineFlagInfo: Additional flags for a virtual machine.

bind.name: memoryMB
bind.description: [optional] Size of a virtual machine's memory, in MB.

bind.name: name
bind.description: [optional] Display name of the virtual machine.

bind.name: numCPUs
bind.description: [optional] Number of virtual processors in a virtual machine.

workflow-item.description: The ConfigSpec data object type encapsulates configuration settings when creating or reconfiguring a virtual machine. To support incremental changes, these properties are all optional. Basic Version

workflow-item.name: item17
workflow-item.script: //Auto generated script, cannot be modified ! System.getModule("com.vmware.library.vc.vm.tools").vim3WaitDnsNameInTools(vm,pollingRate,dnsNameToWait,timeout,addNumberToName) ;

bind.name: vm
bind.description: VM in which the action look to get the new DNS Name

bind.name: pollingRate
bind.description: Time between all request information on the tools [seconds]

bind.name: dnsNameToWait
bind.description: Define a specific DNS name to wait for (either in compute.dunes.ch or compute form)

bind.name: timeout
bind.description: Timeout before throwing a timeout exception [minutes]

bind.name: addNumberToName
bind.description: Specify if the DNS name has an automatically number added at end (not known at clone time)

workflow-item.description:
Wait for a given name in the DNS guest informations (VMware tools).
Exception: - Timeout: When timeout is reached

bind.name: domain
bind.description: The fully qualified domain name.

bind.name: hostname
bind.description: The network host name of the (Linux) virtual machine.

bind.name: customizationLinuxPrep
bind.description: The CustomizationLinuxPrep corresponding

bind.name: dnsDomain

bind.name: dnsServerList

bind.name: gateway

workflow-item.name: item36
workflow-item.script: //Generated by the system, cannot be edited return (numberOfNic >= 3.0) ;

bind.name: sourceVm
bind.description: Clone operation Source VM

bind.name: nic1Type
bind.description: [Optional] Type of Network Interface Card 1 (default is VirtualPCNet32)

bind.name: nic1Network
bind.description: [Optional] Network for Network Interface Card 1 (if not specified, use same as Source)

bind.name: nic2Type
bind.description: [Optional] Type of Network Interface Card 2 (default is VirtualPCNet32)

bind.name: nic2Network
bind.description: [Optional] Network for Network Interface Card 2 (if not specified, use same as Source)

bind.name: nic3Type
bind.description: [Optional] Type of Network Interface Card 3 (default is VirtualPCNet32)

bind.name: nic3Network
bind.description: [Optional] Network for Network Interface Card 3 (if not specified, use same as Source)

bind.name: nic4Type
bind.description: [Optional] Type of Network Interface Card 4 (default is VirtualPCNet32)

bind.name: nic4Network
bind.description: [Optional] Network for Network Interface Card 4 (if not specified, use same as Source)

bind.name: virtualDeviceChanges
bind.description: VirtualDeviceChanges for Network cards

workflow-item.name: item25
workflow-item.script: //Auto generated script, cannot be modified ! actionResult = System.getModule("com.vmware.library.vc.vm").customizeVM(vm,customizationSpec) ;

bind.name: vm
bind.description: VM to clone

bind.name: customizationSpec
bind.description: VimCustomizationSpec: Specifies the ustomization for the virtual machine.

workflow-item.description:
Try to customize a VM. (no clone operation done)
If any Exception appens, raise a "VMware3:CloneException" with no object attached.

workflow-item.name: item27
workflow-item.script: //Auto generated script, cannot be modified ! actionResult = System.getModule("com.vmware.library.vc.basic").vim3WaitTaskEnd(task,progress,pollRate) ;

bind.name: pollRate
bind.description: Polling rate for the task state [seconds]

bind.name: progress
bind.description: Log progess while waiting for the task

bind.name: task
bind.description: Task to Wait for

workflow-item.description: Wait a VIM 3 Task to end. When task ended, return the

bind.name: host
bind.description: [Optional] The host where the virtual machine is to be powered on. If no host is specified, the current associated host is used. This field must specify a host that is part of the same compute resource that the virtual machine is currently associated with. If this host is not compatible, the current host association is used.

workflow-item.name: item24
item37

bind.name: vm
bind.description: The VM to mark as template

workflow-item.description: Mark an existing VM as a template, preventing it to start

bind.description: The location of the new virtual machine.

bind.name: name
bind.description: The name of the new virtual machine.

bind.name: spec
bind.description: VcVirtualMachineCloneSpec: Specifies how to clone the virtual machine.

bind.name: snapshot
bind.description: VcVirtualMachineSnapshot to base the clone of

workflow-item.description:
Try to clone a VM.
If any Exception appens, raise a "VMware3:CloneException" with no object attached.

bind.name: progress
bind.description: Log progess while waiting for the task

workflow-item.name: item2

workflow-item.name: item3

bind.name: text
bind.description: The text to log

bind.name: object
bind.description: The text to log and additional info

workflow-item.description: Log the input text to the console and the server log with level 'error'

workflow-item.name: item43
workflow-item.script: //Auto generated script, cannot be modified ! actionResult = System.getModule("com.vmware.library.vc.vm.network").getNicByNumber(vm,nicPosition) ;

bind.name: vm
bind.description: VM from which to get the network card

bind.name: nicPosition
bind.description: Let you choose if you want to get the 1st, 2nd... 5th network card. If no valid value, 1st if used.

workflow-item.description: Return a Network card device (VimVirtualE1000, VimVirtualVmxnet, VimVirtualPCNet32). The network position let you choose if you want to get the 1st, 2nd... 5th network card.

workflow-item.name: item44
workflow-item.script: //Generated by the system, cannot be edited return (Snapshot != null ) ;

workflow-item.name: item46
workflow-item.script: System.log("Snapshot is defined"); snapshot = Snapshot;

bind.name: Snapshot
bind.description: If null, a new snapshot shall be created

workflow-item.name: item45
workflow-item.script: System.log("Snapshot is null, Creating a new snapshot");

workflow-item.name: item8
workflow-item.script: //Auto generated script, cannot be modified ! actionResult = System.getModule("com.vmware.library.vc.vm.spec").getCustomizationGlobalIPSettingsWithDomainAsString(dnsServerList,dnsSuffix) ;

bind.name: dnsServerList
bind.description: [Optional] List of DNS servers, for a virtual network adapter with a static IP address

bind.name: dnsSuffix
bind.description: [Optional] List of name resolution suffixes for the virtual network adapter

workflow-item.description: A collection of global IP settings for a virtual network adapter. In Linux, DNS server settings are global. The settings can either be statically set or supplied by a DHCP server.

p-param.name: vm
p-param.desc: Virtual machine of which to create a linked clone

p-param.name: name
p-param.desc: Name of the new virtual machine

p-param.name: template
p-param.desc: Mark the new virtual machine as a template

p-param.name: Snapshot
p-param.desc: Snapshot (If null, a new snapshot shall be created)

p-param.name: powerOn
p-param.desc: Power on the new virtual machine

p-param.name: pool
p-param.desc: Resource pool

p-param.name: host
p-param.desc: Host

p-param.name: folder
p-param.desc: Virtual machine folder

p-param.name: datastore
p-param.desc: Datastore in which to store the virtual machine. If not specified, the current datastore is used

p-param.name: doSysprep
p-param.desc: Run the Sysprep operations and wait for the task to complete. Not used if the virtual machine is marked as template

p-param.name: clientName
p-param.desc: Name or prefix name of the Linux client

p-param.name: numberOfNic
p-param.desc: Number of NIC to use

p-group.title: Network interface
p-group.desc: If the mac address is not included, the customization process maps the settings from the virtual machine's network adapters, in PCI slot order.

p-param.desc: The MAC address of a network adapter being customized

p-param.name: nic1Network
p-param.desc: Network on which attach the virtual network interface

p-param.name: nic1Dhcp
p-param.desc: Use a DHCP server to configure the virtual network adapter

p-param.name: nic1IpAddress
p-param.desc: Fixed valid IP address

p-param.name: nic1SubnetMask
p-param.desc: Subnet mask for this virtual network adapter

p-param.name: nic1Gateway
p-param.desc: List of gateways, in order of preference

p-group.title: Information Settable with or without DHCP

p-param.name: nic1DnsDomain
p-param.desc: DNS domain suffix such as vmware.com

p-param.name: nic1DnsServerList
p-param.desc: List of DNS servers for a virtual network adapter with a static IP address

p-param.name: nic2MacAddress
p-param.desc: The MAC address of a network adapter being customized

p-param.name: nic2Network
p-param.desc: Network on which attach the virtual network interface

p-param.name: nic2Dhcp
p-param.desc: Use a DHCP server to configure the virtual network adapter

p-param.name: nic2IpAddress
p-param.desc: Fixed valid IP address

p-param.name: nic2SubnetMask
p-param.desc: Subnet mask for this virtual network adapter

p-param.name: nic2Gateway
p-param.desc: List of gateways, in order of preference

p-group.title: Information Settable with or without DHCP

p-param.name: nic2DnsDomain
p-param.desc: DNS domain suffix such as vmware.com

p-param.name: nic2DnsServerList
p-param.desc: List of DNS servers for a virtual network adapter with a static IP address

p-param.name: nic3MacAddress
p-param.desc: The MAC address of a network adapter being customized

p-param.name: nic3Network
p-param.desc: Network on which attach the virtual network interface

p-param.name: nic3Dhcp
p-param.desc: Use a DHCP server to configure the virtual network adapter

p-param.name: nic3IpAddress
p-param.desc: Fixed valid IP address

p-param.name: nic3SubnetMask
p-param.desc: Subnet mask for this virtual network adapter

p-param.name: nic3Gateway
p-param.desc: List of gateways, in order of preference
